links: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: By the Prime Number Theorem in Arithmetic Progressions, all nonzero residue classes are equiprobable. In particular, sum(k=1..n, a(k)) ~ 8.5n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 16 2012
prog: (PARI) primes(100)%17 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 16 2012(Sage) [mod(p, 17) for p in primes(500)] # _Bruno Berselli_, May 05 2014(MAGMA) [p mod(17): p in PrimesUpTo(500)]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, May 06 2014
author: _Clark Kimberling_
